snippet.title: Zero Tours (ゼロ・ツアーズ) gameplay
snippet.description:
This is a Game Boy Advance RPG from Media Rings Corporation, released on July 27th 2001.

It is also known as Mugen Kinogyou Zero Tours. 

The game features characters known as Kigurumians (キグルミアン) who like to dress up as different animals.

You can battle monsters (known as Nuigurumin) in dungeons and register them. Using a link cable, you may exchange items and Nuigurumin data.

This game supported the Mobile System GB (operable through the Mobile GB Adapter that can link to mobile phones) which was closed on December 14, 2002. You could do things including downloading a new area, peer to peer communication and spreading downloaded data to a communication partner.

Story:
The main protagonists Blueberry Jam and Strawberry Parfait are two siblings who run a shop and live in a small village called the Village of Hope (希望の里). 

One day Blueberry Jam was interested in a rumour that a dragon tribe had appeared. Blueberry Jam really wanted to meet the dragon tribe, so he decided to go on a journey with the dog tribe and cat tribe but he was unable to find it the tribe out of the village.

He tried to ask his old friend Happy from the Fairy Group; a travelling guide person and "tour conductor", as she knows a lot, and their adventure begins.

Fan-site: http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/kakeru/pokemon2/mobile/zero/

Official Japanese Nintendo page: https://web.archive.org/web/20131025230613/http://www.nintendo.co.jp/n08/software/aztj/index.html
